alert.note: Alert for City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 5:07PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent city, City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flash flooding in Virginia Beach. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier today. The heaviest rain has ended, and the Flash Flood Warning that was in effect is being replaced with a Flood Warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Princess Anne, Oceana NAS, London Bridge, Oceana, Macons Corner, Rudee Heights, Princess Anne Plaza, North Virginia Beach, Dam Neck, Pungo, Sigma and Bayside. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
